definition: to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
surname Zhan
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
to appear/present/now/existing/current

sentences.english: Her inner male counterpart wrote the book on celebrating the body beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 她內心對應的那個男性意向對展現外在美很在行。

sentences.english: You can manifest psionic powers more powerful than the normal limits of manifestation.
sentences.chinese: 你可以展現比普通極限更強的靈能。

sentences.english: The beauty host displayed the professional with fluent English.
sentences.chinese: 主持人用流利英語開始了慶典，展現了樂其的專業性。

sentences.english: This first volume reveals the crucial initial steps for getting a short film off the ground.
sentences.chinese: 這是首卷，展現了一個上下車短片關鍵的第一步。

sentences.english: There lies a vast extension of golden crops before us.
sentences.chinese: 一望無際的金燦燦的農作物展現在我們的眼前。

sentences.english: Until then he had been afraid to expose his naked souls.
sentences.chinese: 在那之前，他一直害怕展現自己赤露的靈魂。

sentences.english: The cuisine of Singapore can indicate the ethnic diversity of the culture of Singa­pore.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的美食展現了新加坡文化中的種族多樣性。

sentences.english: When riled , the Druids of the Claw display ferocious power and stamina.
sentences.chinese: 當被激怒時，利爪德魯依便展現出兇猛的力量和耐力。

sentences.english: We wish Nantong Zhanyang Fiber Co. , Ltd a promising future on the land of Haimen.
sentences.chinese: 我們預祝展陽公司在海門大地上展現陽光燦爛的前景。

sentences.english: Don't try to hard:the neconsumedst things come when you least expect them to.
sentences.chinese: 英語不要焦心，最好的總會在最不經意的時間展現。

sentences.english: This master model is a full-scale representation of a part design that incorporates all of the geometry for one of the part surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 原模應以同樣比例大小展現部件表面的形狀設計。

sentences.english: Yeah, it's a good time for us tinkers to show what we can do, eh ?
sentences.chinese: 是啊，可以展現我們工匠們能做些什麼，嗯。

sentences.english: Lush and mouth-filling from start to finish, there is enough acid to support the whole structure while retaining an excellent balance.
sentences.chinese: 適當的酸度不但支持了整體結構亦展現了絕佳的平衡。

sentences.english: This is your chance to show off to the people interviewing you.
sentences.chinese: 這可是你向面試考官展現你自己的好時機。

sentences.english: He has put over good final balls since the start of the season.
sentences.chinese: 從這季初開始，他漂亮的終結傳球會不斷展現。
如果可能的話，展現不斷增長的複雜性。

definition: to appear/to emerge/to present (a certain appearance)/to demonstrate
to embody/to reflect/to incarnate
to manifest
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
appearance/to appear
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
to use/to put to use
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
to pass on/to convey/to relay/to transmit/transmission
unique/distinct/having special characteristics
to build (housing)/to construct/to make
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
to combine/to link/to integrate/binding/CL:次[ci4]
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
